toc-tabbed-internal-nav: <> toc-tabbed-external-nav: <> unusedtitle: <> version: <>","type":"application/x-tiddler-dictionary","tags":"$:/EvidentlyCube/Data/Macro"},"Autocomplete KaTeX Triggers Summary":{"title":"Autocomplete KaTeX Triggers Summary","tags":"doc","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"<>"},"Autocomplete Refnotes Triggers Summary":{"title":"Autocomplete Refnotes Triggers Summary","tags":"doc","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"<>"},"Autocomplete Triggers Summary":{"title":"Autocomplete Triggers Summary","tags":"doc","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"<>"},"Relevant Sort Query":{"title":"Relevant Sort Query","tags":"meta","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"* talk: https://talk.tiddlywiki.org/t/auto-complete-with-sorting-by-relevance/6840 * code: http://craigsturgeon.com/mk/example/Churchill-Example.html#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2Fcls%2Fmk%2Fmodules%2Ffilters%2Frsort.js With the great Auto Complete 3, it is very efficient to find and insert a tiddler. Only one inconvenience is not to list tiddlers by relevant even the exact title is typed when there are many similar tiddlers. The rsort operator by @clsturgeon sounds very useful here. Then I modified filter for ''All tiddlers'' in auto complete plugin through add `rsort` at the end. ``` [all[tiddlers]!is[system]!has[draft.of]search:titlersort] ``` Now it is much easier to find a tiddler I need. * Filter: $:/plugins/cls/mk/modules/filters/rsort.js"},"$:/favorites/folders/autocomplete-katex":{"title":"$:/favorites/folders/autocomplete-katex","caption":"Autocomplete $:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/tags","tags":"$:/tags/Favorites/Folder","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki"},"$:/plugins/cls/mk/modules/filters/rsort.js":{"title":"$:/plugins/cls/mk/modules/filters/rsort.js","text":"/*\ title: $:/plugins/cls/mk/modules/filters/rsort.js type: application/javascript module-type: filteroperator Filter operator for sorting \*/ (function(){ /*jslint node: true, browser: true */ /*global $tw: false */ "use strict"; /* Export our filter function */ exports.rsort = function(source,operator,options) { var results = prepare_results(source); options.wiki.sortTiddlers(results,"title",operator.prefix === "!",false,false); if (operator.operand.length > 0) { var reresults = reorder_results(results, operator.operand); return reresults; } else { return results; } }; var prepare_results = function (source) { var results = []; source(function(tiddler,title) { results.push(title); }); return results; }; var reorder_results = function (source, operand) { const operandArr = operand.split(" "); var results = []; for (let i=0; i<250; i++) { for (let j=0; j 0 ) { var pos=source[j].toUpperCase().indexOf(operandArr[k].toUpperCase()); if (pos==i) { results.push(source[j]); break; } } } } } } return results; }; })();","type":"application/javascript","module-type":"filteroperator","tags":"$:/tags/mk"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/help/shortcuts":{"text":"Shows the shortcuts for AutoComplete triggers.","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/help/shortcuts","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","caption":"Autocomplete shortcuts help","trigger":"?h","filter":"[all[tiddlers]tag[$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger]!is[draft]remove[$:/EvidentlyCube/Trigger/ShortcutsHelp]search:caption]","display-filter":"[get[caption]] [[ (]][get[trigger]] ) +[join[]] ","template":"$option$$caret$","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","auto-trigger-input":"1","transform-filter":"[get[trigger]]"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/history":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/history","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"Full change log https://kookma.github.io/TW-Triggers/#ChangeLog * ''0.5.0'' -- 2025.07.26 -- beta release "},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/icon":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/icon","text":"","type":"image/svg+xml"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/images/core-icons":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/images/core-icons","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Core svg icons","display-filter":"[removeprefix[$:/core/images/]]","filter":"[all[tiddlers+shadows]prefix[$:/core/images/]!is[draft]search:title]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"<>$caret$","trigger":"?i","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"-> This trigger uses `svg:` to list all core svg images -> It then inserts the image using `doc-svg` from kookma Utility plugin like below `<>`"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/images/emojis":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/images/emojis","auto-trigger-input":"1","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Emoji from dictionary","display-filter":"[]","filter":"[[$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/data/emojis]indexes[]] :map[[$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/data/emojis]getindexaddprefix[ (]addprefixaddsuffix[)]] +[search:title]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"$option$","transform-filter":"[search-replace:g:regexp[ \(.+],[]]","trigger":"?:","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"-> Showcases using data indexes for pulling data -> This particular case deals with the issue that we want to be able to filter the emojis by their name but want to just insert the emoji. There is no good way in TiddlyWiki to get the key (index/preoprty) if you know its value, so we hack around this by having both the emoji and the text in the suggestion. -> We could also strip the name of the emoji in Display Filter using the same filter as in Transform Filter."},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/katex/arrows":{"text":"","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/katex/arrows","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","caption":"KaTeX arrows","trigger":"\a?","filter":"nrightarrow mapsto longmapsto rightarrow longrightarrow leftarrow leftrightarrow nRightarrow downarrow Rightarrow Longrightarrow uparrow rightsquigarrow leadsto updownarrow greek letters","trigger":"\g?","filter":"Alpha Beta Gamma Delta Epsilon Zeta Eta Theta Iota Kappa Lambda Mu Nu Xi Omicron Pi Rho Sigma Tau Upsilon Phi Chi Psi Omega varGamma varDelta varTheta varLambda varXi varPi varSigma varUpsilon varPhi varOmega alpha beta gamma delta epsilon zeta eta theta iota kappa lambda mu nu xi omicron pi rho sigma tau upsilon phi chi psi omega varepsilon varkappa vartheta thetasym varpi varrho varsigma varphi digamma R N Z +[searchrsort]","display-filter":"[]","template":"\$option$$caret$","auto-trigger-textarea":"1"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/katex/logics":{"text":"","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/katex/logics","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","caption":"KaTeX logics","trigger":"\l?","filter":"forall exist nexists in notin complement subset supset mid land lor ni therefore because mapsto to gets leftrightarrow notni empty varnothing implies impliedby iff neg :filter[searchrsort]","display-filter":"[]","template":"\$option$$caret$","auto-trigger-textarea":"1"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/katex/operators":{"text":"","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/katex/operators","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","caption":"KaTeX operators","trigger":"\o?","filter":"sum int iint iiint oint oiint oiiint prod coprod intop smallint bigotimes bigoplus bigodot biguplus bigvee bigwedge bigcap bigcup bigsqcup roman names","trigger":"\r?","filter":"sin sinh arcsin cos cosh arccos tan tanh arctan sec coth min csc det max cot dim exp ker log deg inf liminf ln arg sup limsup lg gcd lim ominus hbar succ odot circ succeq otimes star propto oslash surd doteq upharpoonright checkmark :and[join[]]","filter":"[all[tiddlers+shadows]tag[$:/EvidentlyCube/Data/Macro]indexes[]search:title]","template":"$option$$caret$","transform-filter":"[all[tiddlers+shadows]tag[$:/EvidentlyCube/Data/Macro]getindex]","trigger":"?m"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/readme":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/readme","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"; Zarzycki|https://github.com/EvidentlyCube]] ;Code and demo For learning plugin features, syntax, tutorial and examples see the plugin demo and code pages * Demo: https://kookma.github.io/TW-Triggers/ * Code: https://github.com/kookma/TW-Triggers "},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/refnotes/literature-multiple":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/refnotes/literature-multiple","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Multiple citation","display-filter":"[]","filter":"[tag[bibtex-entry]!is[system]!has[draft.of]search:title]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"<>","trigger":"/m","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"Find literature as multiple reference"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/refnotes/literature-narrative":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/refnotes/literature-narrative","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Narrative citation","display-filter":"[]","filter":"[tag[bibtex-entry]!is[system]!has[draft.of]search:title]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"<>","trigger":"/n","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"Find literature as narrative reference"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/refnotes/literature":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/refnotes/literature","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Find literature and cite","display-filter":"[]","filter":"[tag[bibtex-entry]!is[system]!has[draft.of]search:titlersort]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"<>","trigger":"/c","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"Find literature"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/fields":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/fields","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Field name","display-filter":"[] [[ (Uses: ]] [all[tiddlers]!is[system]hascount[]] ) +[join[]]","filter":"[all[tiddlers]!is[system]!is[draft]fields[]search:titlesort[]]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"field:$option$","trigger":"?f","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"-> Useful when writing filters, this trigger will list defined variables. -> Note that Display Filter has some additional logic to append (Uses: 123) after the name of the variable. -> Note that Template has no $caret$ in it, which causes the caret to be put at the end of inserted text"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/snippets":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/snippets","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Insert snippet","display-filter":"[get[caption]]","filter":"[all[tiddlers+shadows]tag[$:/tags/TextEditor/Snippet]!is[draft]search:title]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"$option$","transform-filter":"[get[text]]","trigger":"?s","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"List of all snippet"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/tags":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/tags","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Tag name","display-filter":"[] [[ (Uses: ]] [all[tiddlers]!is[system]tagcount[]] ) +[join[]]","filter":"[all[tiddlers]!is[system]!is[draft]get[tags]enlist-input[]unique[]search:titlesort[]]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"$option$","trigger":"?t","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"-> Useful when writing filters, this trigger will list defined variables. -> Note that Display Filter has some additional logic to append (Uses: 123) after the name of the variable. -> Note that Template has no $caret$ in it, which causes the caret to be put at the end of inserted text"},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/tiddler-link-alias":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/tiddler-link-alias","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Tiddler link with alias","display-filter":"[]","filter":"[all[tiddlers]!is[system]!is[draft]search:titlersort]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"[[$caret$|$option$]]","trigger":"?a","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"-> It triggers after typing `||` and simply lists all Tiddlers matching your query, without any additional filtering or changing how the results display. -> Unlike `[[` this actually uses the `$caret$` token purposefully."},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/tiddler-links":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/tiddler-links","auto-trigger-input":"1","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Tiddler Link","display-filter":"[]","filter":"[all[tiddlers]!is[system]!is[draft]search:titlersort]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"[[$option$]]$caret$","trigger":"?l","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"-> This is identical to the trigger you get when you create a new one. -> It triggers after typing `[[` and simply lists all tiddlers matching your query, without any additional filtering or changing how the results display. -> Note that `$caret$` in Template is redundant as the caret will automatically be placed at the end of the inserted text if the caret token is not present "},"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/wigets":{"title":"$:/plugins/kookma/triggers/tiddlywiki/wigets","auto-trigger-textarea":"1","caption":"Widget","display-filter":"[search-replace[action-],[Action: ]search-replace:g:regexp[(\w)field],[$1 field]search-replace:g:regexp[(\w)tiddler],[$1 tiddler]search-replace:g:regexp[\bset(\w)],[set $1]]","filter":"[all[tiddlers+shadows]field:module-type[widget]search-replace:g:regexp[^.+/(.+)\.js$],[$1]search:title]","tags":"$:/tags/EC/AutoComplete/Trigger","template":"<$$option$$caret$","trigger":"?$","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"-> Auto complete for widgets -> It finds the widget names by looking at their file name - so if there is a filter which name doesn't match its file name it won't work correctly -> Display template does a lot of processing just to show its capabilities; plus regardless of what is displayed in the result you insert what `Filter` returns"}}}
